page.title: 09RELIGION IN ENNISKILLEN
page.content: There are six churhes in the area and three of these are built within 50 yards of each other.These are the Roman Catholic,the Church of Ireland and the Methodist.These are all built on the island, to the west, and along with the Presbyterian church,also on the island to the east,they are over 100 years old.Off the island to the west are another Church of Ireland and the Jehovah Witnesses. In the town old religious {attitudes}are still strong and church attendance is still fairly high.This is probably the result of strong Roman Catholic beliefs and the Protestant ethos of Sunday Observance.In the town there are more Catholics than Protestants,and today there is some ecumenical worship,but it is very limited.
